Hearing your own name activates your brain's reward center the same way money or food does, even when you're asleep. - Fun Facts
You have roughly equal numbers of bacterial and human cells—about 38 trillion of each. You're a 50/50 partnership with microbes. - Fun Facts
Your brain's visual cortex rewires itself if you go blind, repurposing that area to process sound and touch with superhuman precision. - Fun Facts
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance.' These pink birds form groups of up to a million individuals and perform elaborate synchronized dances to attract mates. - Fun Facts
Muhammad has been the most popular baby boy's name in England for two years running. - Fun Facts

During WWII, Japanese diplomat Chiune Sugihara defied his government to save 6,000 Jewish refugees. He wrote visas by hand for 29 days straight, even throwing them from his train window as he was forced to leave. - Fun Facts

In scientific experiments, rats consistently chose to free their trapped companions from cages, even when chocolate was offered as an alternative. They would then share the chocolate with their freed friend. - Fun Facts

A completely silent song on Spotify called "Sleepify" earned a band over $20,000 in royalties before being removed. Fans played it on repeat overnight while sleeping to support the band Vulfpeck, who used the money to fund a free tour. - Fun Facts

The first iPhone demo in 2007 was so unstable that Apple engineers created a "golden path" - a specific sequence of actions Steve Jobs had to follow exactly during the presentation. If he deviated even slightly, the prototype would crash, so they had multiple phones ready backstage to swap in if needed. - Fun Facts

The mantis shrimp has 16 types of color receptors compared to humans' 3, but despite this they're actually terrible at distinguishing between similar shades. Scientists believe they use colors more like a barcode scanner than a camera. - Fun Facts
All clownfish are born male. When the dominant female in a group dies, the dominant male will transform into a female to take her place—making Finding Nemo's plot biologically impossible. - Fun Facts
The inventor of the Pringles can is buried in one. Fredric Baur was so proud of his creation that he requested part of his ashes be stored in a Pringles container after his death in 2008. - Fun Facts
